alert.note: Alert for Childress (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 11:21AM CDT until further notice by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lubbock TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N affecting Childress County. For the Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River...including Childress 10N... minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Cattle grazing in the flood plain are threatened by rising water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet this afternoon. It should then fall below flood stage by early this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged if walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CDT.
